item.title: Advanced Cluster Security - Authentication
item.description: Red Hat Advanced Cluster Security (RHACS) Central is installed with one administrator user by default. Typically, customers request an integration with existing Identity Provider(s) (IDP). RHACS offers different options for such integration. In this article 2 IDPs will be configured as an example. First OpenShift Auth (which is available since RHACS v3.67) and second Red Hat Single Sign On (RHSSO) based on Keycloak
